Description: A tall pottery cup of pale cream-green marlware; wheelmade, convex base and slightly convex sides. The rim is plain with a thin edge, chipped in places. There is a groove around the vessel just above the base. The interior of the sides exhibits clear rilling-lines. The pale greenish fabric contains some grit inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 19A has been scratched on the item.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 65, 66 § 61, pl. xxxv, 76)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.93, p.103, p.192, pl.34)
